page.title: Jake and the Never Land Pirates

revisions.rev:
{{Infobox television | show_name = Jake and the Never Land Pirates | image = [[File:Jake and the Never Land Pirates.png|225px]] | caption = | genre = [[Children's television series|Children's Television]] | format = [[Animated television series]] | creator = [[Bobs Gannaway]] | writer = | director = [[Howy Parkins]] | creative_director = | voices = [[Colin Ford]]
[[Madison Pettis]]
[[Jonathan Morgan Heit]]
[[David Arquette]]
[[Corey Burton]]
[[Jeff Bennett]]
[[Loren Hoskins]]
[[Ariel Winter]]
[[Dee Bradley Baker]] | country = [[United States]] | language = [[English language|English]] | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 27 (aired) | list_episodes = List of Jake and the Never Land Pirates episodes | executive_producer = [[Rob DaLuca]] | producer = [[Mark Seidenberg]] | editor = [[Mark Seidenberg]] | runtime = Two eleven-minute episodes | company = [[Walt Disney Television Animation]]
[[Glowing Studios Limited]]
Disney Junior Original Productions | network = [[Disney Junior]] | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_aired = {{Start date|2011|2|14}} | last_aired = present | status = Airing | website = }} '''''Jake and the Never Land Pirates''''' is a [[music]]al [[animated]] [[Disney Junior]] show based on the successful [[Disney]] franchise, ''[[Peter Pan (1953 film)|Peter Pan]]''. It is the first [[Disney Junior]] original show following the switch from [[Playhouse Disney]].{{cite news| url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/la-ca-disney-jr-20110213,0,1124544.story | work=Los Angeles Times | first=Yvonne | last=Villarreal | title=Kids' TV: Disney Channel's preschool programming switches message to social values | date=February 13, 2011}}{{cite news| url=http://communityvoices.sites.post-gazette.com/index.php/arts-entertainment-living/tuned-in-journal/27284-disney-junior-launches-today }} It stars [[Colin Ford]], [[Madison Pettis]], [[Jonathan Morgan Heit]], [[David Arquette]], [[Corey Burton]] and [[Jeff Bennett]].http://disneychannelmedianet.com/web/showpage/showpage.aspx?program_id=3126360&type=lead ==Premise== {{expand section|date=February 2011}} The show revolves around a group of three children (two boys and a girl) who are pirates in Never Land (vs. Peter Pan's Neverland), looking for treasure. Their main obstacle is [[Captain Hook#Disney|Captain Hook]], [[Smee]], and Captain Hook's feared nemesis, Tick-Tock the Crocodile from Disney's [[Peter Pan]] franchise. Captain Hook usually sees Jake and his crew doing something fun and steals it from them, and Jake and his crew have to get it back. After they succeed, Jake and his crew count their [[Doubloon|gold doubloons]] (which they receive after solving each "pirate problem"). Each program contains two eleven minute animated episodes, followed by a live-action song by the [[Captain Bogg and Salty|Never Land Pirate Band]]. The singing characters "Bones" and "Sharky" appear in both animated and live action forms. ==Cast/Characters== ===Main characters=== ; '''Jake''' :{{Voiced by|[[Colin Ford]]}} :Jake is the main protagonist of the series and leader of the Never Land Pirates. He has a wooden sword, which was given to him by Peter Pan. He is Captain Hook's main pirate rival. ; '''Izzy''' :{{Voiced by|[[Madison Pettis]]}} :Izzy is the only girl pirate in the group. She has a small sack of pixie dust, which was given to her by the fairies ([[Tinker Bell]] and her friends). The team only uses the pixie dust for emergencies. However, there had been episodes whe pixie dust is not used at all. Her catchphrase is "Yay, hey, no way. ; '''Cubby''' :{{Voiced by|[[Jonathan Morgan Heit]]}} :Cubby is the youngest of the group with his catchphrase ,"Aw, coconuts!" He has the map of Never Land. Cubby is not a member of the "Lost Boys", despite the fact he physically resembles the Cubby of the group. ; '''Skully''' :{{Voiced by|[[David Arquette]] (Speaking), [[Loren Hoskins]] (Singing)}} :Skully is a small, green parrot who acts like a guardian to the team. He keeps a lookout for Captain Hook and Mr. Smee. ; '''[[Captain Hook]]''' :{{Voiced by|[[Corey Burton]]}} :Captain Hook is Neverland's resident pirate captain and the main antagonist of the series. Commander of the galleon "The Jolly Roger". Legendary for his cruelty to his enemies as well as his own men, Hook has trouble holding onto a permanent crew. In fact at the moment, he only holds three members at the moment. ; '''[[Mr. Smee]]''' :{{Voiced by|[[Jeff Bennett]]}} :Mr. Smee is Captain Hook's "left-hand man", first mate, and the secondary antagonist of the series, but he usually apreciatre jake's and his crew help . ; '''Sharky and Bones''' :{{Voiced by|[[Loren Hoskins]] and [[Kevin Hendrickson]]}} :Sharky and Bones are members of Captain Hook's pirate crew. They usually spend time performing musical numbers rather than advancing the plot, acting as troubadours. Live action versions appear at the end of the show and perform an original song. ; '''Marina the Mermaid''' :{{Voiced by|[[Ariel Winter]]}} :A young mermaid who lives in the ocean around Never Land with the rest of her people. Unlike other young female merfolk, who tend to be snobbish, selfish, vain and downright cruel, Marina is gentle and kind to the young pirates. She often shows them the secrets of the Never Sea she finds. It is hinted that she has a crush on Jake. [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4-k_jF0LAfM] ;'''Tick-Tock the Crocodile''' :{{Voiced by|[[Dee Bradley Baker]]}} :The very same crocodile that devoured Captain Hook's left hand after Peter Pan cut it off in a sword fight some years ago. Tick-Tock loved the taste of Captain Hook's hand so well, he has followed the Jolly Roger ever since, licking his chops as he imagines the rest of his meal. And he also swallowed an alarm clock to goes tick-tocking to warn Captain Hook. ===Recurring characters=== * [[Russi Taylor]] - Never Bird - A former sidekick of Captain Hook who she soon betrays and joins forces with Jake and his crew. * [[Loren Hoskins]] - Sandy the Starfish - Marina the Mermaid's singing pet starfish with the ability to heal with a special song. * [[Tori Spelling]] - Pirate Princess - A legendary pirate who was cursed and shipwrecked in a hidden grotto but rescued by Izzy and the others. * [[Lisa Loeb]] - Winger - Skully's close friend who reveals to be the princess of the Sky Bird Kingdom. * [[Adam West]] - Wise Old Parrot - An aged scarlet macaw and ruler of the Sky Bird Kingdom. * [[Sharon Osbourne]] - Mama Hook - Captain Hook's mother * [[Jane Kaczmarek]] - Red Jessica - A swashbuckling pirate with whom Captain Hook falls in love with. * [[Josh Duhamel]] - Captain Flynn - A pirate who became stranded on the Never Land desert with his ship The Barracuda but rescued by Jake and the Never Land Pirates. ==Episodes== {{main|List of Jake and the Never Land Pirates episodes}} ==Reception== The series received generally positive but lukewarm reviews. A review in ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' called it "[p]art video game, part interactive cartoon, part advertisement for 'Peter Pan' merchandise".{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117944630|title=Jake and the Never Land Pirates|author=Brian Lowry|publisher=''Variety''|published=02-15-2011|accessdate=2011-04-24|date=February 15, 2011}} A review in ''[[The Los Angeles Times]]'' stated that Captain Hook "has been laundered â reasonably enough, yet sadly as well â into a shell of his former self, too silly to be frightening, not even a decent bully, just a kind of (much) older boy who wants to steal your toys."{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/feb/15/entertainment/la-et-jake-and-pirates-20110215|publisher=''The Los Angeles Times''|title=Television review: 'Jake and the Never Land Pirates'|author=Robert Lloyd|published=02-15-2011|accessdate=2011-04-24|date=February 15, 2011}} [[Common Sense Media]] rated it "on" for ages 3 and older, praising the educational content, role models, and especially the messages of the show, and expressing only mild concern about the moderate violence.{{cite web|url=http://www.commonsensemedia.org/tv-reviews/jake-and-never-land-pirates|title=Jake and the Never Land Pirates|accessdate=2011-04-24}} As the flagship of the newly-launched Disney Junior channel, the series was rated the most-watched program among boys ages 2â5 during its first few weeks on the air, with 2.9 million viewers, including 1.1 million ages 2â5, and over 600,000 women ages 18â49 (presumed to be mothers and other caregivers).{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/04/12/disney-junior%E2%80%99s-%E2%80%9Cjake-and-the-never-land-pirates%E2%80%9D-sails-to-series-highs-on-saturday/89175|author=Disney press release|title="Jake and the Never Land Pirates" Hit Series Highs on April 9|published=04-13-2011|accessdate=2011-04-24}} On July 27, the series was awarded #2 of the Best TV Shows 2011 list.[http://www.screenjunkies.com/tv/tv-lists/best-tv-shows-2011/] The character Jake has to received positive reviews. The character has been thought of as a "classic Disney character", lovable and entertaining addition. He has quickly become an icon at [[Disney's Hollywood Studios]] from the popular ''Disney Junior Live'' as well as being added on the park's entrance drawings. ==International dubs and Broadcast== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
